name: bowing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
bow
to bend your head or body forward, especially as a way of showing someone respect or expressing thanks to people who have watched you perform: They bowed to the Queen. We bowed our heads in prayer. He bowed down (= very low) before (= in front of) the king and begged for mercy. Compare
curtsy verb
More examplesFewer examplesThey bowed deferentially as she came into the room.The children bowed their heads in shame.The Princess, visibly moved, kept her head bowed during the ceremony.They had to bow to the Prince.She bowed down before the King.
